skill.name: scientific-schematics
skill.description: Create publication-quality scientific diagrams using Nano Banana Pro AI with smart iterative refinement. Uses Gemini 3 Pro for quality review. Only regenerates if quality is below threshold for your document type. Specialized in neural network architectures, system diagrams, flowcharts, biological pathways, and complex scientific visualizations.
skill.summary: Create publication-quality scientific diagrams using Nano Banana Pro AI with smart iterative refinem...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, persistence, or obfuscated execution patterns found. Network calls are limited to OpenRouter API for image generation and review. Behavior matches the stated diagram generation purpose.

content.value_statement: Scientific diagrams are slow to design and hard to standardize. This skill generates publication-ready schematics with review-based refinement and saves the final image and log.
actual_capabilities: Generate diagram images from natural language prompts
Review diagram quality with Gemini 3 Pro scoring
Stop early when the quality threshold is met
Save versioned images and a review log file
limitations: Image quality depends on model output and prompt clarity

use_cases.title: Journal figure creation
use_cases.description: Create publication-ready flowcharts or pathways with strict quality thresholds for papers.

use_cases.title: Lecture diagram prep
use_cases.description: Generate clean architecture and system diagrams for slides with faster thresholds.

use_cases.title: System documentation
use_cases.description: Produce block diagrams and data flow visuals for design documents and reports.

prompt_templates.title: Simple flowchart
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simple flowchart showing data collection, cleaning, analysis, and reporting. Use clear labels and top to bottom flow.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture diagram
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a system architecture diagram with sensors, edge device, cloud API, database, and mobile app. Left to right flow, labeled arrows.

prompt_templates.title: Neural network layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Draw a transformer encoder decoder architecture with labeled blocks, attention modules, and cross attention. Use clean spacing and readable labels.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed pathway
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a MAPK pathway diagram from EGFR to nucleus with labeled phosphorylation steps, membrane boundary, and colorblind safe palette.

output_examples.input: Make a CONSORT participant flow diagram for a poster.
output: Publication-ready flowchart with participant counts and exclusions
Readable labels with clear top to bottom flow
Saved image file and a review log with score and critique

best_practices: Provide layout direction and key labels
Specify document type for the right quality threshold
Include color or accessibility requirements when needed
anti_patterns: Using vague prompts with no components or labels
Expecting more than two refinement iterations
Running without a valid OpenRouter API key

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is designed for use within Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What are the iteration limits?
faq.answer: The generator allows one or two iterations, with early stop when quality meets the threshold.

faq.question: Can it integrate with LaTeX or papers?
faq.answer: Yes, it outputs image files you can include with standard LaTeX figure commands.

faq.question: Does it access my local credentials?
faq.answer: No, it only uses the OpenRouter API key you provide and does not read other secrets.

faq.question: What if image generation fails?
faq.answer: Check your API key, network access, and try a clearer prompt or verbose mode.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual diagram tools?
faq.answer: It is faster for drafts and iterations, but manual tools may allow finer control.
